overview: Four LGBTIQ members tell their story of living whilst gay in Ghana, west Africa. Following up to the Ghanaian president Nana Akuffo-Addo remarks in an interview with the Aljazeera network, on the chance of gay freedom in Ghana, these four victims, representing the gay community in Ghana stands in front of the camera to tell the risk of being gay in a country where itâ€™s an abomination to be gay because of its religious morals.
title: Living with Colors in Ghana
